topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b0fd0363687206d35b0300#post_53b0fd0363687206d35b0300
[bq="trashboat"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b0fc7d6368727609290000#post_53b0fc7d6368727609290000
Momotaros: Momotaros has no Idea what you're Talking about! GRAAAGH!!

OOC: Seriously though, What are you talking about?[/bq]
I was creating a video game model and for the last hour and a half it's been crashing when I try to do a step to create a texture for it and a corner had a extra bit on it that was causing a error so every time it would try to apply it would get caught in a vicious cycle and crash my program.  Imagine having to notice a single speck of dust on a wall essentially.  The problem was driving me crazy for the class assignment and I was going, "Am I going nuts or something?" only for it be a small problem that was just hard to notice.

topics.body:
Well prepare to run for the hills just in case:
In case you missed it the Hobby Lobby lawsuit that has reached the supreme court is to be decided soon.


Why is this the most important court case of the decade?  Cause if the court rules in favor of Hobby Lobby freedom of religion in the USA will be gutted entirely.  What I mean by this is anyone in the USA that isn't Christian if they rule in favor of Hobby Lobby we're all pretty fucked.  Why?  Cause you will essentially no longer have any religious rights.

Also if they rule in favor of Hobby Lobby even if you're Christian your rights as a employee are pretty fucked as well.

Tl:dr; return to the dark ages.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b1914663687214fce20200#post_53b1914663687214fce20200
6/30/2014: The day freedom of religion and rights of the worker got fundamentally gutted to make way for christian beliefs.

I don't mean to sound like a asshole to christians, but what this means with the court ruling is that the rights of a company and the religious practices of business owners supersede YOUR rights completely.  It is already being looked at using this precedence to strip not only women's rights, but worker rights, religious rights and glbt rights.  By using this court case as a spring board the anti-glbt movement is already looking at trying to gut glbt rights in the work force under "religious expression".


Again not trying to be rude, *BUT* christians. . . do you seriously not see what you guys get so much shit from everyone?  They essentially ruled that the religious practices of a business owner supersede your individual rights and again you wonder why you get so much shit from non-christians?




Also under this ruling it could be ruled that even things like blood transfusions or vaccines could violate a company's religious practices.
